body:
hi,
I managed to compile it on a powerbook 1.25 G4
so the answer  it's: yes it works!
my system has:
10.3.3 panther
radiance 3.5 binaries
pmap 3.28




the way I did it is:


download the archives from
http://www.ise.fhg.de/alt-aber-aktiv/radiance/photon-map/download.html


put all the archives .tar.gz in the same new directory called Test ( just a
name.. )


you decompress radiance archive (rad3R5.tar.gz) in the directory Test with
tar -xvf rad3R5.tar.gz


then there should be a new directory called ray inside Test. (I do this way
because stuffit doesn't work...)


now from the same location, inside Test, type 
tar -xvf pmap-3.28.tar.gz


you should have only two .gz file and a ray directory....




now:




1 - go into ray


2 - type ./makeall install from ray


3 - select the text editor you like (pico it's my preferred)


4 - select a directory for the compiled binaries like ~/Desktop/bin (must be
created before; be carefull with permission)


5 - choose 7th option (macosX)


6 - select the library location (be carefull with permission)


7 - select your options by editing the file, if you dare ;-)) (I use
defaults...)




should be ok....


cheers,
giulio




PS sometimes I use this optimisation with G4 and radiance (not with pmap):
(you get up to 30% more)
 -fast -mcpu=7450
but could be a little buggy sometimes....
